name: Transport for London
goal: Transport for London (TfL) is the integrated body responsible for London’s transport system. It manages London’s buses, London Underground, the Docklands Light Railway, some suburban railway services known as London Overground and London Tramlink. It also manages some piers on the River Thames, Victoria Coach Station, the Emirates Air Line and supports the London Transport Museum. As well as running London’s Low Emission Zone, the Ultra Low Emission Zone and the Congestion Charging scheme, TfL manages a 580km network of main roads, all of the city’s 6,000 traffic lights, regulates taxis and the private hire trade and is responsible for a public cycle hire scheme known as Santander Cycles. Our objective is to keep London moving, working and growing and make life in the city better.
interests: Business and Industry, Climate Action, Competition, Consumers, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Taxation, Trans-European Networks, Transport
